circumstances: Leanne Bruce, known for her meticulous nature, was reported missing after failing to return to her residence at 26 Bolam Drive, Burntisland. Concerns had been raised by her friend due to Leanne’s struggle with addiction, which some feared might have escalated into a crisis. Her family conducted an extensive search, liaising closely with local contacts including her close associate, Gillian Gough. Clues pointed towards potential visits to addresses like 1 Crossroads Place and 9 Lowry Place, in Rosyth, which were associated with past acquaintances. However, she was eventually located safe at 1 Canmore Street, Kinghorn. It appeared she had sought temporary refuge with Louise Dyer, finding a supportive environment to confront her challenges.
q_6_explanation: Struggles with addiction may affect her social interactions.
q_7_explanation: Has a known struggle with addiction that raises dependency concerns.
q_18_explanation: Leanne sought refuge to confront her addiction issues.

circumstances: Leanne Bruce was last seen boarding a train, reportedly leaving 26 Bolam Drive, Burntisland. Her son mentioned she recently developed an interest in alternative lifestyles, possibly joining a survivalist community or a commune, which might explain her disappearance. Leanne’s sister, who lives at 16 Albert Street, Rosyth, noted that Leanne had a new romantic partner whose identity remained unknown to the family. Concern grew when Leanne did not contact her close friend living at 53 Newton Crescent, Rosyth. The police traced her to a location in Kinghorn, following leads that linked her newfound interests and acquaintances. Leanne’s brother, Neil Harding, expressed relief upon her safe return, though questions about her absence persist.
entities_addresses: Kinghorn,16 Albert Street Rosyth,53 Newton Crescent Rosyth,16
entities_pattern_types: possibly joined commune,part of survivalist community,new romantic partner unknown to others
q_17_explanation: Her recent changes in lifestyle are unlike her usual behavior.
q_18_explanation: Interest in alternative lifestyles may have motivated her disappearance.
